'''Óswine''', the '''Prince of Gwar''', was the ruler of the city of [[Kortirion#Other versions of the legendarium|Kortirion]]<ref group="note">Kortirion was the [[Qenya|Elvish]] name of the town of [[wikipedia:Warwick|Warwick]].</ref><ref>{{LT2|VI}}, outline '''30''', p. 310</ref> in [[Luthany#Other versions of the legendarium|Lúthien]] (i.e. [[wikipedia:England|England]]), according to the early version of the [[legendarium]] in the text called ''[[Ælfwine of England]]'' from ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]''.<ref name="Osw"/>

== History ==
Óswine was a "lover of songs", and was friendly to the [[Elves]] that still remained in Lúthien, congregating mostly in the lands surrounding Kortirion, called [[Alalminórë]] or the "Land of [[Elms]]". In his city also dwelt [[Ælfwine]], who would later discover [[Tol Eressëa]], as well as his parents, the [[Minstrels|minstrel]] [[Déor (father of Ælfwine)|Déor]] and [[Éadgifu]] of [[Lionesse]].

He was killed during the siege of Kortirion by the fierce people called the [[Forodwaith (The Book of Lost Tales)|Forodwaith]] (that is, the [[wikipedia:Vikings|Vikings]]).<ref name="Osw">{{LT2|VIb}}, p. 313</ref>

== Etymology ==
The name ''Óswine'' is in [[Old English]], consisting of the elements ''ós'' ("god") + ''wine'' ("friend").<ref>{{LT2|VIb}}, p. 323</ref>

For the explanation of the name ''Gwar'' in Óswine's title, ''Prince of Gwar'', see: [[Kortirion#Etymology and names]].
